Value statement: As an Infra Engineer for Bip AI, I want Slack to receive real-time Harness pipeline status updates so the team can quickly see progress and react to failures.

Acceptance criteria
- When a user joins the configured Slack channel(s), they can see subsequent pipeline status updates posted by Harness.
- When any pipeline in the Bip AI project starts, succeeds, fails, or is aborted, a message posts to the configured channel within 60 seconds and includes: pipeline name, environment, service, status emoji, commit SHA/author (when available), and a deep link to the execution.
- When a manual approval is required, an approval notification posts to the configured channel.
- If environment-based routing is enabled (dev/stage/prod), notifications are delivered to the corresponding channel(s).

Value statement: As an Infra Engineer for Bip AI, I want Slack to receive real-time Harness pipeline status updates so the team can quickly see progress and react to failures.

Acceptance criteria

As an Infra Engineer for Bip AI, I want a reusable Slack alert step template so teams can add standardized, context-rich Slack notifications to any pipeline with minimal setup.

Acceptance criteria
- When the template is added to any pipeline with a valid Slack connector and channel, a message posts with correct context and a deep link to the execution.
- When notifyOn is set to failure, only failed executions post; when set to success, only successful executions post; when set to all, start and completion messages post with appropriate status.
- Template works at both stage-level and pipeline-level and respects conditional execution (e.g., run only on failure).
- Template is versioned, documented (description/notes), and includes an example usage snippet.

As an Infra Engineer for Bip AI, I want a reusable Slack alert step template so teams can add standardized, context-rich Slack notifications to any pipeline with minimal setup.

Acceptance criteria
 - When the template is added to any pipeline with a valid Slack channel, a message posts with correct context and a deep link to the execution.
 - Template works at both stage-level and pipeline-level and respects conditional execution (e.g., run only on failure).
 - Template is versioned, documented (description/notes), and includes an example usage snippet (create a readme file within the repo on how to us it).

Description: As a BIP AI Engineer who is responsible for validating application health after deployments, I need to run Playwright MCP automated tests in the smoke test pipeline so that I can quickly verify core functionality and detect regressions across tenants


AC:
- When the smoke test pipeline runs, the Playwright MCP agent is invoked as part of the pipeline execution.
- When the Playwright MCP agent is executed, it runs the defined set of smoke test scripts against the target environment.
- When the tests complete, the pipeline displays results in the Jenkins build output, including pass/fail status and any errors.

Description:
As a Bip AI Engineer who monitors pipeline health, I need the smoke test pipeline to send Slack notifications with Playwright MCP test results so that I can be alerted to failures or errors without having to manually check the Jenkins console output.
-When the Playwright MCP smoke tests fail, a Slack message is sent to the pipelines channel with the failure status and a summary of failed checks.
- When the Playwright MCP smoke tests pass, a Slack message is sent to the pipelines channel summarizing the successful run
- When the Slack notification is sent, it includes a link back to the Jenkins job for full details.

items.from_string: configure Smoke Test pipeline slack notifications
items.to_string: Configure Smoke Test pipeline slack notifications

Value Statement
As a BIP AI tenant user who accesses mlflow from SageMaker, I need the ability to obtain EntraID issued jwt token via mlkit cli so that I can authenticate to mlflow from SageMaker notebook.

Acceptance Criteria

1 Add EntraID's device code flow implementation in mlkit cli.
2 Update mlflow tutorial notebook to use the flow generated jwt token to access mlflow
3. Update mlflow helm chart to reenable oauth2proxy annotation in ingress.

Value Statement:

As a DevOps engineer managing the BIP AI infrastructure, I need to deprecate the vbms-mlmats-xrc ArgoCD application and remove its associated values to eliminate legacy infrastructure and consolidate claim management under the new bip-ai-claims system.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Remove the vbms-mlmats-xrc application definition from the bip-ml-mats-infrastructure repository (specifically the crossplane-claims-app.yaml file in argocd-apps/templates/)
- Remove all associated values files for vbms-mlmats-xrc from the bip-ml-mats-infrastructure-values repository across all environments (dev, stage, preprod, prod, sbx, sbx-ephemeral)
- Remove values configurations for all regions (us-gov-east-1, us-gov-west-1) where applicable
- Verify that all existing claims have been successfully migrated to the bip-ai-claims system before deprecation
- Update any remaining documentation references to vbms-mlmats-xrc to point to the new bip-ai-claims system
- Create pull requests for both repositories with clear deprecation messaging and migration context
- Ensure no active workloads or dependencies remain on the vbms-mlmats-xrc application before removal

**Definition of Done:**
- Pull request created for bip-ml-mats-infrastructure repository removing the ArgoCD application definition
- Pull request created for bip-ml-mats-infrastructure-values repository removing all values configurations
- Both pull requests include comprehensive commit messages explaining the deprecation and migration context
- Pull requests have been submitted for review to the BIP Engineering team
- Code review discussions completed and any feedback addressed
- Both pull requests approved by required reviewers
- Both pull requests successfully merged to main branches
- ArgoCD confirms the application no longer exists in all environments

**Story:**
As a DevOps engineer managing the BIP AI infrastructure, I need to archive the bip-ml-mats-infrastructure and bip-ml-mats-infrastructure-values repositories to complete the deprecation of legacy infrastructure and ensure all workloads have been successfully migrated to the new bip-ai-infrastructure system.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Verify no active ArgoCD applications remain that reference bip-ml-mats-infrastructure repository (bip-ai-gateway, mlmats-api, mlmats-ui, mlmats-plugins, mlflow apps)
- Confirm all Helm charts have been migrated from bip-ml-mats-infrastructure/charts to bip-ai-infrastructure/charts
- Ensure all values configurations have been migrated from bip-ml-mats-infrastructure-values to bip-ai-infrastructure-values
- Update all documentation references pointing to bip-ml-mats repositories to reference the new bip-ai repositories
- Verify the vbms-mlmats-xrc application has been fully deprecated and removed
- Check all GitHub workflows, renovate configurations, and integration tests no longer reference the old repositories
- If active dependencies exist, create follow-up stories to detach those dependencies before archival
- Create GitHub repository archive requests for both bip-ml-mats-infrastructure and bip-ml-mats-infrastructure-values repositories

**Definition of Done:**
- Dependency analysis completed and documented showing no active workloads or integrations depend on bip-ml-mats repositories
- If dependencies found, follow-up user stories created and prioritized to remove those dependencies
- If no dependencies found, both repositories successfully archived in GitHub with appropriate archive messages
- Archive notification sent to BIP Engineering team with summary of completed migration
- All documentation updated to reflect the archived status and point to new infrastructure repositories
- Confirmation that no ArgoCD applications, CI/CD pipelines, or automation tools reference the archived repositories
- Repository archive status verified in all environments where the repositories were previously referenced

**Story:**
As a frontend developer working on the BIP AI platform, I need to modularize the All Resources view Vue.js components by extracting reusable functionality into separate components to improve code maintainability, enable component reuse across the application, and reduce the complexity of the main view.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Extract the main data table component into a separate reusable Vue file
- Modularize the pause functionality component for standalone use
- Extract the deep pause feature into its own component
- Create a separate component for the hard refresh functionality
- Modularize all modal components used in the All Resources view
- Extract any other reusable UI elements or utility functions into separate components
- Ensure all extracted components maintain their current functionality and behavior
- Update the All Resources view to import and use the new modular components
- Implement proper props and events communication between parent and child components
- Add appropriate component documentation and prop validation
- Maintain all existing CSS styling and responsive behavior

**Definition of Done:**
- All Resources view file length significantly reduced while maintaining full functionality
- Each extractable feature exists as an independent Vue component in separate files
- All modular components properly tested and validated in SBX environment
- No functionality lost during the modularization process
- Component props and events properly defined with TypeScript interfaces where applicable
- All new components follow Vue.js and project coding standards
- Pull request created with clear description of modularization changes
- Code review completed by team members with approval
- Pull request successfully merged to main branch
- SBX testing confirms all features work as expected post-modularization
This issue is cloned by BIP-27675

**Story:**
As a DevOps engineer managing the BIP AI infrastructure, I need to migrate all Crossplane tenant claims from the mlmats tenant ArgoCD instance to the bip-ai claims application in the tooling ArgoCD instance to consolidate claim management and enable the deprecation of legacy mlmats infrastructure.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Copy all claim values from bip-ml-mats-infrastructure-values to bip-ai-infrastructure-values for each environment (dev, stage, preprod, prod, sbx, sbx-ephemeral)
- Allow tooling ArgoCD to sync and create new claims with pause annotations (crossplane.io/paused=true) to prevent resource duplication
- Execute the claim-migration.sh script in bip-ai-infrastructure/scripts/utilities/kubernetes/ to transfer Crossplane ownership gracefully
- Remove ArgoCD tracking metadata from old claims to prevent conflicts during pruning
- Comment out old claim values in bip-ml-mats-infrastructure-values and allow tenant ArgoCD to sync
- Remove finalizers from old claims after ArgoCD is ready to prune them (as prompted by migration script)
- Update target revision to 0.97.5 in all AppSet files to permanently remove pause annotations from new claims
- Verify all migrated claims are healthy, synced, and reconciling properly in tooling ArgoCD
- Troubleshoot and resolve any failed migrations or unhealthy claims

**Definition of Done:**
- All tenant claims successfully migrated from mlmats tenant ArgoCD to bip-ai tooling ArgoCD across all environments
- Migration script executed without errors and all claim ownership transfers completed
- Old claims pruned from clusters and no longer visible in tenant ArgoCD applications
- New claims in tooling ArgoCD show healthy status and are actively reconciling Crossplane resources
- Target revision updated to 0.97.5 and pause annotations removed from all new claims
- All composite resources correctly point to new claims in bip-ai namespace
- No resource duplication or conflicts between old and new claim systems
- Documentation updated to reflect new claim management process in tooling ArgoCD
- Migration process validated in all environments with comprehensive testing of claim functionality

As an BIP-AI member, I need a new EntraID Group created for the RBAC Saga to properly manage access control and permissions for BIP infrastructure components.

- Track a new EntraID Group from VA, which will form the basis for cluster permissions for the infra team. Follow the established naming convention and be integrated with the existing RBAC framework for BIP infrastructure.

### Summary
As a BIP-AI tenant, I need a Crossplane composition for AWS API Gateway REST APIs to deploy and manage APIs for models and applications with Lambda, HTTP, and AWS service integrations.

### Acceptance Criteria

**Functional Requirements**
- Crossplane composition provisions:
  - REST API with resources, methods, and deployments
  - Multiple stages (dev, test, prod)
  - IAM execution roles
  - Lambda proxy/custom integrations
  - HTTP/AWS service integrations
  - Request/response models and validators
  - Authorizers (IAM, Lambda, Cognito)
- Per-request resource creation for tenant flexibility
- CRD with clear field descriptions

items.from_string: API Gateway IaC for Self-Service API Management
items.to_string: Develop API Gateway IaC for Self-Service API Management

A/C
Implement the solution to fix and set Bedrock permissions across all Sagemaker domains.

## Story
As a platform engineer managing AI tenant infrastructure, I need the XSagemakerDomainRole composition to automatically create IAM policy statements that grant access to tenant-specific inference profiles, so that SageMaker domain execution roles can invoke only their authorized Bedrock inference profiles while maintaining strict tenant isolation and security boundaries.

## Acceptance Criteria
- The XAiTenantIntake composition passes inference profile data from `status.resources.inferenceProfiles` to the XSagemakerDomain object
- The XSagemakerDomain composition forwards inference profile data to the XSagemakerDomainRole object through parameters
- The XSagemakerDomainRole composition parses the inference profiles JSON document to extract all inference profile ARNs
- The XSagemakerDomainRole composition creates IAM policy statements that allow `bedrock:InvokeModel` actions on the specific inference profile ARNs
- The policy statements are added to the execution role's inline policy alongside existing permissions
- Each tenant's execution role can only access their own inference profiles, maintaining tenant isolation
- The policy generation handles edge cases such as empty inference profile lists gracefully
- Template validation passes for all generated IAM policies

Value Statement
As a BIP AI MLOps Engineer who provisions resources, I need the ability to create Lambda functions from code in a tenant’s Git repo using Jenkins so that deployment is automated and consistent.

Acceptance Criteria

When the Jenkins pipeline runs, it packages the Lambda code from the tenant’s Git repo and creates the Lambda function.
Manual validation: Confirm Lambda functions are created successfully from the repo via Jenkins automation.

Value Statement

Acceptance Criteria

Manual validation: Confirm multi-agent collaboration is functional.

Value Statement: As a BIP AI MLOps Engineer, I need the ability to research AWS Bedrock Evaluation and document requirements, use cases, and recommendations so that BIP AI devs can appropriately evaluate Bedrock invocations to ensure successful outcomes and efficient usage.

Documentation is created in Confluence following the technical documentation template. Recommendations are tailored to BIP AI needs. Acceptance Criteria

Value Statement

Acceptance Criteria

As an MLE supporting Figma MCP, I want to run a pilot program with the VBMS Frontend Engineers to trial the Figma MCP artifacts and Prompt Engineering (PE) artifacts, so that we can gather feedback, remove blockers to adoption, and evolve the artifacts toward long-term ownership by the VBMS team.

AC: 1. Identify a subset of VBMS engineers to participate in the pilot program. 2. Confirm that pilot participants are using the Figma MCP + PE artifacts in their workflows. 3. Provide support and unblock issues during the pilot (e.g., adjusting PE files as requested). 4. Deliver a summary of findings + recommended next steps for broader adoption and eventual ownership by VBMS.

Value Statement
As a developer who will leverage Playwright MCP, I would like to integrate Playwright MCP to with a VBMS use case.

Acceptance Criteria
Successful integrate playwright MCP with VBMS use case.
